We have many statements. We need to parse them, maybe construct directed graph edges: Ancestor relationship can be thought of as a directed edge from ancestor to descendant? Actually "A is B's ancestor" means A is ancestor of B, so directed from A to B (A -> B). Meanwhile "A is B's descendant" means A is descendant of B, so B is ancestor of A. So we can treat both as edges that indicate direction: If "X is Y's ancestor" => X -> Y (directed from ancestor to descendant). If "X is Y's descendant" => Y -> X. So we unify.
